item.title: Unraveling the Complexities: Navigating OpenShiftâ€™s Compliance Operator
item.description: Introduction to the Compliance Operator The OpenShift Compliance Operator is all about keeping your OpenShift cluster secure and in line with governance policies. It does this by scanning both the OpenShift Platform 4 (ocp4) and Red Hat Core OS 4 (RHCOS4). Now, let’s break down the types of compliance checks it can handle: Platform (Cluster) Related Checks: These checks use the OpenShift API to make sure everything is shipshape. Node Related Checks: These scans take a closer look at the filesystem of each node.
